perturbation.original_text: This Form of Sub-Reseller Agreement (this “Sub-Reseller Agreement”) is made and entered in by and between salesforce.com, inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, California 94105 (“SFDC” or “Salesforce”) and the Reseller named above and amends that certain Reseller Agreement between Salesforce and Reseller dated as of August 1, 2015, as previously amended (the “Agreement”). This Sub-Reseller Agreement is effective as of the later of the dates beneath the Parties’ signatures below (“Sub-Reseller Effective Date”), provided, however, that the dates of the Parties’ signatures are not separated by a period of time greater than ten (10) business days. If such period is greater than ten (10) business days then this Sub-Reseller Agreement shall be deemed null and void and to be of no effect.
perturbation.changed_text: This Form of Sub-Reseller Agreement (this “Sub-Reseller Agreement”) is made and entered in by and between salesforce.com, inc., a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, California 94105 (“SFDC” or “Salesforce”) and the Reseller named above and amends that certain Reseller Agreement between Salesforce and Reseller dated as of August 1, 2015, as previously amended (the “Agreement”). This Sub-Reseller Agreement is effective as of the later of the dates beneath the Parties’ signatures below (“Sub-Reseller Effective Date”), provided, however, that the dates of the Parties’ signatures are not separated by a period of time greater than thirty (30) business days. If such period is greater than thirty (30) business days then this Sub-Reseller Agreement shall be deemed null and void and to be of no effect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that if the dates of the parties’ signatures are separated by a period greater than ten (10) business days, the agreement is null and void. By changing this period to thirty (30) business days, we introduce a deviation from what is considered a standard or reasonable timeframe for contract execution, potentially creating enforceability issues, as unduly long periods may suggest a lack of mutual agreement or changed circumstances. While there is no specific law that states the days need to be a maximum of 10, this change is relevant in general contract law regarding mutual agreement. A period of more than 10 days could invalidate the contract due to potentially lacking agreement. This is under the common law.

perturbation.original_text: Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub- Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller.
perturbation.changed_text: Reseller must ensure that Sub-Reseller complies with some of the terms of the Agreement applicable to Reseller as if Sub-Reseller were an original party to the Agreement and any breach by Sub-Reseller of the Agreement will be deemed a breach by Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'the terms' to 'some of the terms', the text introduces ambiguity regarding which terms the Sub-Reseller must comply with. By not specifying certain standards, it can cause a contradiction in regulatory compliance. This is under the common law.

perturbation.original_text: The terms and conditions herein contained constitute the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Sub-Reseller Agreement and supersede any previous and contemporaneous agreements and understandings, whether oral or written, between the Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: The terms and conditions herein contained constitute most of the agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Sub-Reseller Agreement and supersede some previous and contemporaneous agreements and understandings, whether oral or written, between the Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter hereof.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains the 'entire agreement clause'. The change of 'the' to 'most of the' and 'any' to 'some' introduces ambiguity which potentially causes conflicts with general contract principles. This is under the common law.
